intro: Crepis neglecta f. graeca, commonly known as the Greek goat's beard, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. The plant produces achenes, which are dry, indehiscent fruits, typical of the Compositae family. It is native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia, often found in rocky or disturbed habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and relatively rare species within its native range.
